attributes.action: expand the railway network to cover Leigh and Lowton
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For way too long, the town of Leigh in Lancashire has been the largest town in the UK to not have a railway link. Lowton is regularly becoming congested with traffic trying to avoid the A580 East Lancs Road.
We feel that with the current development in the area, especially the Leigh Sports Village, a railway link is long overdue as opposed to the guided busway proposal.
All large towns in the UK should have good access to the rail network to provide good public transport and promote the local economy by providing improved transport links for local businesses. The extra benefit would also be to reduce road congestion in the area and provide local employment.
